data.text: devam gnes koruma

What do you all use for sun protection? My nose and lips burn easily even after reapplying sunscreen. I’m thinking of using a gator but was wondering if it would fog up my sunglasses. May be a good sunblock that doesn’t wash away with sweat?￼￼￼
following
data.author: Johnny Cameron

data.text: Bullfrog SPF 50. It's a gel, so it soaks in and is not sticky or greasy like a lotion. Best sunscreen ever.
data.author: Philip Key

data.text: Nose protector clips to bridge of sunglasses. Looks stupid but works great.
data.author: Will Taylor

data.text: Long sleeves and a buff are standard in South Florida. Add in a wide brim if summer! https://www.instagram.com/p/Buu2VNjBOvQ/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=
data.author: William Griggs

data.text: You have to renew all sunscreens about every 2 hrs More if you are sweating a lot. Just the way it is. Should not be a big deal as stopping every hour to look around and rest is not a bad thing.
data.author: Bill Heimann

data.text: I really like the coolibar UPF 50 layered mask. I got it off Amazon.
data.author: Debra Chatham

data.text: Children's sunscreen with zinc oxide, it wont melt or burn your eyes.
data.author: Chuck Butler

data.text: I use sun sleeves on my arms and legs. Sunscreen on my face and neck. Be sure to reapply every two hours.
data.author: Ty Dawley

data.text: i put a sunvisor into my helmet, that way my face is protected and i also got white sleeves to protect my arms.
data.author: Gabi Kundert

data.text: They make leather nose guards that go over the bridge of glasses that give full protection from the sun.
data.author: Ralph Durham

data.text: I wear sleeves... on my face I'll do Badger sunblock and lip balm to help.
data.author: Mark Stratmann

data.text:
Da brim! https://dabrim.com/products/sporty-cycling
Sporty Cycling Helmet Visor Brim
dabrim.com
data.author: Daisy Philtron

data.text: Use a dabrim. Stable up to 60km/h with the additional stabilisator. Long sleeves of merino, long trousers (synthetic)
data.author: Georges Froidevaux

data.text: I worked for 11 years at elevation (9,000 - 11,000 ft). SPF 50, 3-5 daily. It swears off so reapply.
data.author: Steve Perkins

data.text: Get some glacier mountain glasses. They have a nose cover
data.author: Alan Smiles

data.text:
https://sunbutteroceans.com.au/products/sunbutter-50spf-water-resistant-sunscreen Swear by this!
SunButter SPF50 Water Resistant Reef Safe Sunscreen
sunbutteroceans.com.au
data.author: James Sampson

data.text: I like a buff that is wetted down and cover my lips and nose some times. Not only protects sun but cools and moisturizes. And wide brim hats. I usually don't ride with a helmet unless the situation calls for it.
data.author: Andy Decker

data.text: Also, stick some green branches into the front holes of your helmets to make a visor on the fly. Pick the right one and you might get a refreshing smell in your face .
data.author: Andy Decker

data.text: Sunscreens are a problem of their own and should be avoided.
data.author: Andy Decker

data.text: Small hat fits under helmet.
data.author: David Baker-Yuill

data.text: Desperate times, desperate measures
data.author: Gordon Green

data.text: I use bandaid ( the one you just cut it for yourself) or simple cheap bandaid tape . This will give you the best protection . Hardly noticeable.
data.author: Edina Niksz

data.text: I also use Da Brim...3 weeks touring in the sun and it was great
data.author: Tim Timmy

data.text: I use a sweat proof sports sun blocker. The Australian Cancer Council make one that comes in a range of bottles and tube sizes up to 500ml, and it is cheap. However, I also use a fishing cap with face and neck viel. These caps are fairly common as anglers/fishermen can spend a lot of time sitting in the sun next to water (reflected UV). Most sports shops that sell fishing gear will have them.
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text: The only really effective option is to cover up - arm sleeves, trousers, 50+ sunscreen, helmet cover with peak. In Australia I burn in 10 minutes, in Europe I don't even need sunscreen!
data.author: Liz Zylinski

data.text: Zinc oxide paste
data.author: Stacey Bolton

data.text: , there is a zinc protection in this product. I am very fair skinned as well and I put this on my lips and earlobes as they seem to be more sensitive to the sun. Regular 50 block nutregena spray for other areas.
data.author: Brent Smith

data.text:
You could use a sunscreen stick with zinc which is used by surfers like https://www.eq-love.com/de/bio-sonnenschutz-sticks-gesicht/19-sonnenschutz-stick-blau-lsf50.html It won't go away by sweat. At the end of the day you might need to wash it away with olive oil, for example
Sonnen-Gesichtsstick Blau LSF 50+ – Sehr hoher Sonnenschutz
eq-love.com
data.author: Sabrina Dusel

data.text: Da brim
data.author: Margaret Houghton

data.text: every one loves this thing. I ordered one two days ago. The only one they had in stock was the sport. It’s a little bit smaller. ￼ is that the one you have? Do you feel it provides enough shade? ￼￼￼￼
data.author: Jr Macintire

data.text:
I’ve used my Dabrim on 2 rides. Works great! www.dabrim.com. Made in SF Bay Area!
Da Brim Helmet Visor Brim
dabrim.com
data.author: Eric McCrystal

data.text: Lol, everyone always yells at me because I almost never use sun protection. I usually only burn the first day though and then after that I am good.
data.author: Gerald Raton

data.text: a giant hat?
data.author: Fritz Rösch
